Uses of Package
moxie

  • Packages that use moxie 
    Package Description
    moxie
    Moxie: a wicked good Java mocking library.
    moxie.hamcrest
    This package contains Hamcrest matchers and related classes used internally by Moxie (though you're welcome to use them in your tests as well).
  • Classes in moxie used by moxie 
    Class and Description
    Cardinality
    Domain-specific language methods used to specify how many times an event (method call, sequence of method calls) is expected to occur.
    Check
    Domain-specific language methods for setting out the details of a retrospective mock validation.
    ClassCheck
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications on static methods and constructors.
    ClassExpectation
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set expectations on static methods and constructors.
    Expectation
    Domain-specific language methods for setting out the details of a mock object expectation.
    Group
    Represents an ordered list of expectations that should occur in a strict order across mocks; or, an unordered set of expectations which should be separately verifiable as complete.
    LambdaCheck
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications using lambda syntax.
    LambdaExpectation
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set mock expectations using lambda syntax.
    MoxieControl
    Primary point of interaction between Moxie and test classes.
    MoxieMatchers
    Static class whose methods magically signal Moxie to flexibly match parameters of a mock expectation.
    MoxieOptions
    Options that can be specified in the creation of mocks, spies or groups.
    ObjectCheck
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that perform post-invocation verifications on mock object instances.
    ObjectExpectation
    Interface containing domain-specific language methods called in "the middle bit" of statements that set expectations on mock object instances.
    Predicate
    Interface for a method object that returns true or false depending on whether an input value matches some criteria.
    ThrowingRunnable
    Interface for a no-arg method object that does not return a value.
    ThrowingSupplier
    Interface for a no-arg method object that returns a value.
  • Classes in moxie used by moxie.hamcrest 
    Class and Description
    Predicate
    Interface for a method object that returns true or false depending on whether an input value matches some criteria.
